title: Writing code, saving sanity
text:
Step 1: tidyr::pivot_longer()

raw |>
  tidyr::pivot_longer(cols = starts_with('premium'), 
                      names_to = 'currency',
                      values_to = 'premium')

# A tibble: 9 √ó 4
  policy_id class_of_business currency    premium
      <dbl> <fct>             <chr>         <dbl>
1         1 liability         premium_usd  100000
2         1 liability         premium_gbp      NA
3         1 liability         premium_cad      NA
4         2 property          premium_usd      NA
5         2 property          premium_gbp  105000
6         2 property          premium_cad      NA
7         3 cyber             premium_usd      NA
8         3 cyber             premium_gbp  100000
9         3 cyber             premium_cad   15000

title: Writing code, saving sanity
text:
Step 2: dplyr::filter()

raw |>
  tidyr::pivot_longer(cols = starts_with('premium'), 
                      names_to = 'currency',
                      values_to = 'premium') |>
  dplyr::filter(!is.na(premium))

# A tibble: 4 √ó 4
  policy_id class_of_business currency    premium
      <dbl> <fct>             <chr>         <dbl>
1         1 liability         premium_usd  100000
2         2 property          premium_gbp  105000
3         3 cyber             premium_gbp  100000
4         3 cyber             premium_cad   15000

title: Writing code, saving sanity
text:
Step 3: dplyr::mutate()

raw |>
  tidyr::pivot_longer(cols = starts_with('premium'), 
                      names_to = 'currency',
                      values_to = 'premium') |>
  dplyr::filter(!is.na(premium)) |>
  dplyr::mutate(currency = stringr::str_remove_all(currency,
                                                   pattern = 'premium_'),
                currency = base::toupper(currency))

# A tibble: 4 √ó 4
  policy_id class_of_business currency premium
      <dbl> <fct>             <chr>      <dbl>
1         1 liability         USD       100000
2         2 property          GBP       105000
3         3 cyber             GBP       100000
4         3 cyber             CAD        15000

title: Writing code, saving sanity
text:
Step 4: dplyr::mutate()

raw |>
  tidyr::pivot_longer(cols = starts_with('premium'), 
                      names_to = 'currency',
                      values_to = 'premium') |>
  dplyr::filter(!is.na(premium)) |>
  dplyr::mutate(currency = stringr::str_remove_all(currency,
                                                   pattern = 'premium_'),
                currency = base::toupper(currency),
                premium_usd = forex_rates[currency] * premium)

# A tibble: 4 √ó 5
  policy_id class_of_business currency premium premium_usd
      <dbl> <fct>             <chr>      <dbl>       <dbl>
1         1 liability         USD       100000      100000
2         2 property          GBP       105000       81900
3         3 cyber             GBP       100000       78000
4         3 cyber             CAD        15000       20400

title: Writing code, saving sanity
text:
Step 5: dplyr::summarise()

raw |>
  tidyr::pivot_longer(cols = starts_with('premium'), 
                      names_to = 'currency',
                      values_to = 'premium') |>
  dplyr::filter(!is.na(premium)) |>
  dplyr::mutate(currency = stringr::str_remove_all(currency,
                                                   pattern = 'premium_'),
                currency = base::toupper(currency),
                premium_usd = forex_rates[currency] * premium) |>
  dplyr::summarise(total_premium_usd = sum(premium_usd),
                   .by = 'policy_id')

# A tibble: 3 √ó 2
  policy_id total_premium_usd
      <dbl>             <dbl>
1         1            100000
2         2             81900
3         3             98400

title: Writing code, saving sanity
text:
Step 6 (Optional): remove qualifiers

library(tidyverse)

raw |>
  pivot_longer(cols = starts_with('premium'), 
               names_to = 'currency',
               values_to = 'premium') |>
  filter(!is.na(premium)) |>
  mutate(currency = str_remove_all(currency,
                                   pattern = 'premium_'),
         currency = toupper(currency),
         premium_usd = forex_rates[currency] * premium) |>
  summarise(total_premium_usd = sum(premium_usd),
            .by = 'policy_id')

# A tibble: 3 √ó 2
  policy_id total_premium_usd
      <dbl>             <dbl>

2         2             81900
3         3             98400
